results.name: Odd part of A340147: a(n) = A000265(A247074(A003961(n))).
comment: Each term a(n) is a divisor of A340075(n), at n=85 occurs the first proper divisor.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8191
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
program: A003961(n) = { my(f = factor(n)); for(i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); };
A247074(n) = { my(f=factor(n)); eulerphi(f)/prod(i=1, #f~, gcd(f[i, 1]-1, n-1)); }; \\ From A247074
xref: Differs from related A340075 for the first time at n=85, where a(85) = 3, while A340075(85) = 9.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 30 2020
